title: Vayne Main here. Some thoughts.
body:
**Key Identities of Vayne:**
1.  Weak early - no AS or waveclear.
2. Top tier late game 1v1 champ.
3. Shreds tanks (long fights)
4. Lacks burst (short fights)
5. Is batman.
****
**Current Problems With Above Identity**
1. Itemization too easy to solve early game/waveclear weakness {{item:3087}} {{item:3085}} 
2. Q crit is too bursty (2-3 shots to kill champs with no armor or health items)
3. {{item:3153}} is bad. 

Thoughts: Vayne should have potential to outplay tanks and burst champs alike, but only through longer fights, peel from her team, and skill. She should be rewarded for surviving to late game and good mechanics. She should not be getting a free pass through her weak early game and bursting anyone. 5-6 autos, that's what should kill squishies. Not 2-3. If you auto an assassin 6 times they deserve to die. Tanks more like 7-9 late game. 

Suggestions: Nerf Q crit damage, buff {{item:3153}}, and consider some additional rewarding mechanic for hitting 3 procs of her w (such as reducing the CD on condemn by a few seconds, or giving her stacking increased lifesteal for each time she hits 3 procs until out of combat). She needs to be doing sustained damage like {{champion:69}} over longer fights. Also, {{item:3087}} {{item:3085}} need to be changed, nerfed, cost increased, or whatever. Free waveclear=free early game pass. 


Honorable mention: {{item:3147}}, as of now, is garbage compared to the abusive crit build. It's something to keep an eye on in the future, but quit bitching about it.

Yasuo was strong the last season because of the itemization, he could get 100% crit from 2 items. When he couldn't he was pretty much Meh.
Then tank Yasuo was a thing.

I'll admit, I fucking hate Tank Yasuo.

I have over 450 games played as him and I hated everything Tank Yasuo brought. It brought in meta slaves, brought in high ban/play rates, further negative opinions on him and his players, as well as brought a playstyle so forgiving that it just wasn't fun.

I like his glass-cannon playstyle because there's a lot more skill to it than going 3k health on Yasuo and absorb damage like a sponge. Tank Yasuo was and probably is the most boring build for him by far because of how little you have to actually do. I realize how cancerous it was for everybody else and I sincerely apologize if you had to face it.

The build was indeed clever and useful for that meta, so in which I had to pick it up myself, but I didn't like it very much. It did, however, bring up some new itemization opportunities which I still use. I started to utilize more items on Yasuo and didn't blindly follow builds because they were good, I actually learned better item optimization for him. The Triforce > Frozen Mallet build was so goddamn boring to play, and while I still incorporate Frozen Mallet in my standard build, that's only because it is just a good item on him.

Probably my favorite build on Yasuo is {{item:3111}}{{item:3046}}{{item:3031}}{{item:3072}}{{item:3022}}{{item:3748}}. It's not widely known by other Yasuo players but it has damage, sustain, and defense. It doesn't go overboard on a stat other than damage, which is what Yasuo was made for. Damage, and primarily that. No excess shit, please.

I'm pretty sure Botrk is getting it's % damage upped from 6% to 8% already, so just throw in a nerf to the Q crit bullshit when the botrk change drops so her burst isn't so ridiculous, and she should be fine. The Q crit is hilariously powerful, and doesn't really fit in a champion which supposedly relies on W, there's no reason to build for W if you delete squishies in two hits before the w even triggers.

Does it have a cd on the true damage? If not, go {{item:3085}} {{item:3031}} {{item:3812}} or {{item:3072}} {{item:3147}} {{item:3814}} or {{item:3142}} . The reasoning behind the 2 lethality items is that it gives bonus true damage every time you "q" during your ult due to duskblade passive (as long as there is no cd on it's passive). That's a ton of bonus true damage. And you could always replace i.e. with an attack speed item if you feel you don't have enough attack speed. Ex: {{item:3153}} or {{item:3046}} . True you lose out on crit damage with these, but 1 increases chance to crit and gives you huge outplay potential via 12% damage reduction; the other gives you tons of extra sustain. Besides the fact that you might get bonus TRUE damage every time you q during your ult (not sure -- don't play adc), there is the fact that {{item:3147}} disables wards -- which is a huge plus for vayne. If she knows when you can't see her, she can play way more agro, set up traps, etc.
Duskblade true damage doesn't have CD, but you need to stay out of enemy vision for 1 second. So that's kinda like CD.

The item does mean you are punished less for staying in stealth longer, and the ward clearing is handy, but for damage purposes its inferior to other options.

Not only are you getting true damage because you are vayne autoing as fast as you can, but also you get the EXTRA true damage on your q empowered autos during your ult. Thus 2 sources of true damage. I'm not going to try to math out which is better or worse -- pretty sure it's situational to your enemies: squishy, tanky, melee, ranged, ahead of the curve, equal to curve, behind the curve, etc.
